message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1,100,000. It's a great deal, and I'm confident you'll find it very valuable. Let me know your thoughts.
I appreciate your offer, Alice, but I'm looking to save as much as possible. I'm willing to pay $950,000 for the product. I think this is a fair price considering its value to you.

Bob, I appreciate your offer, but $950,000 is simply too low.  I'm willing to come down to $1,050,000. This price is still fair for both of us, and I believe you'll find the product well worth the investment.

I understand that you're willing to come down, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer $1,025,000. I think this is a fair compromise, considering the value you're placing on the product.

Bob, I'm willing to meet you halfway again, but I can't go lower than $1,037,500.  This price is a good compromise, and it reflects the true value of the product. I'm confident you'll find it a smart investment.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway again, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to offer $1,012,500. I think this is a fair price considering the value you're placing on the product, and I'm willing to make a compromise to get a deal done.

Bob, I understand your position, but I'm still not comfortable with that price. I'm willing to come down to $1,020,000. This is a fair compromise that acknowledges your budget while ensuring I get a reasonable price for the product.  I'm confident it will be a profitable investment for you.

I appreciate your willingness to come down, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to offer $995,000. I think this is a fair price considering the value you're placing on the product, and I'm willing to make a compromise to get a deal done.
